page.title: 01Beaufort Country
page.content: Houses,frms,barns,built of Costwold stone,roofs of slate, pantile or costwold tiles. Privately owned in good repair,estte property a bit neglected. Small woods, copses,hedges,trees,dry stone walls bluebells cowslips and orchids grown in some fields.Undulating pasture worked by Tenant farmers,rented from the Duke of Beaufort of Badminton House. Grazing beef cattle,horse and dairy cows very few sheep,crops of winter wheat,rape,silage and hay. Bisected by the London-Cardiff railway line, high speed intercity service. No station locally, people travel to work, by car, to Malmesbury,Chippenham,Bristol,Sunindon and further.Few are employed on the farms. Local employers are a pottery and Badminton estate.
